text.0: heard be our prayer in thought i honour agni first now straightway we elect this heavenly company indra and vāyu we elect.
text.1: for when our latest thought is raised and on vivasvān centred well.
text.2: then may our holy songs go forward on their way our songs as twere unto the gods.
text.3: as there ye mitra varuṇa above the true have taken to yourselves the untrue with your mind with wisdoms mental energy.
text.4: so in the seats wherein ye dwell have we beheld the golden one.
text.5: not with our thoughts or spirit but with these our eyes yea with the eyes that soma gives.
text.6: aśvins the pious call you with their hymns of praise sounding their loud song forth to you these living men to their oblations living men.
text.7: all glories and all nourishment lords of all wealth depend on you.
text.8: the fellies of your golden chariot scatter drops mighty ones of your golden car.
text.9: well is it known o mighty ones ye open heaven for you the chariotsteeds are yoked for morning rites unswerving steeds for morning rites.
text.10: we set you on the chariotseat ye mighty on the golden car.
text.11: ye seek midair as by a path that leads aright as by a path that leads direct.
text.12: o rich in strength through your great power vouchsafe us blessings day and night.
text.13: the offerings which we bring to you shall never fail gifts brought by us shall never fail.
text.14: these somadrops strong indra drink for heroes poured pressed out by pressingstones are welling forth for thee for thee the drops are welling forth.
text.15: they shall make glad thy heart to give to give wealth great and wonderful.
text.16: thou who acceptest praise come glorified by hymns come thou to us benevolent.
text.17: quickly o agni hear us magnified by us thou shalt speck for us to the gods adorable yea to the kings adorable.
text.18: when o ye deities ye gave that milchcow to the aṅgirases.
text.19: they milked her aryaman joined with them did the work he knoweth her as well as i.
text.20: neer may these manly deeds of yours for us grow old never may your bright glories fall into decay never before our time decay.
text.21: what deed of yours new every age wondrous surpassing man rings forth.
text.22: whatever maruts may be difficult to gain grant us whateer is hard to gain.
text.23: dadhyac of old aṅgiras priyamedha these and kaṇva atri manu knew my birth yea those of ancient days and manu knew.
text.24: their long line stretcheth to the gods our birthconnexions are with them.
text.25: to these for their high station i bow down with song to indra agni bow with song.
text.26: let the invoker bless let offerers bring choice gifts bṛhaspati the friend doth sacrifice with steers steers that have many an excellence.
text.27: now with our ears we catch the sound of the pressstone that rings afar.
text.28: the very strong hath gained the waters by himself the strong gained many a restingplace.
text.29: o ye eleven gods whose home is heaven o ye eleven who make earth your dwelling.
text.30: ye who with might eleven live in waters accept this sacrifice o gods with pleasure.
